title: Recent review
text:
After reading several bad reviews and a couple recent good ones, I decided to give the lights and the app a shot.  I bought a starter kit at the hardware store and downloaded the app.  After setting up the network, which was simple, and downloading a few firmware updates, everything worked flawlessly.  I've since purchased several more lights for the house.  I assume a recent update solved whatever bugs people were complaining about earlier.

The lights are wirelessly controlled from your phone with the app, and are dimmable.  You can also adjust the color temperature from soft white to daylight, 2700k-6500k, on bulbs which come with that option.

The app allows you to control lights individually, group lights by room, and set various scenes.  It enables you to set schedules and program vacation modes, but my favorite feature is the morning wake-up...it's hard to beat waking up to the lights in your bedroom slowly coming on over the course of 20 minutes.  I'll take that over a jarring alarm clock any day.  It also has sounds you can pair with this feature that are supposed to play from your phone, such as chirping birds, but I haven't gotten that to work yet.  If the program has a bug, this is the only one I've found so far.  I'd like to try it once it's fixed.

My only suggestion, aside from fixing the audible portion of the morning wake-up, would be to allow programming of scenes or somehow more intuitively set the ending color temperature and brightness level for the wake-up feature.

But overall a great start on what I think will be the future of home lighting, and I'm definitely grateful for the improved start to my day.

title: Technical support saved the day!
text:
I bought this system over a year ago to control he brightness of our entry light, which is on the same switch as the lights on our gatepost and walkway lights.  The entry light is in the ceiling, and I wanted to use the LED faux-can light replacement as a solid structure to cover the hole in the ceiling, so wasps and critters couldn‚Äôt get in there.

The problem with this is that conventional LED replacement lights for can fixtures are all very bright (65-watt equivalents) and usually 3000K or whiter light, and I wanted something about 25-watt equivalent and 2700K.  The Lightify system allowed me to tune my LED can light replacement to 20% brightness and 2700K and then keep it that way after I turned the power off and back on at the switch.

It worked fine for about a year, and then all of a sudden quit controlling the brightness, thus making a blinding 100% bright light come on every time I turned on the switch.  It did keep the 2700K setting.  I could still dim it to 20% with the app, but that was very bothersome.

So I emailed tech support, and Stephan responded quickly, saying that my light had not upgraded properly and thus couldn‚Äôt "remember" my custom dimmer setting as the default.  He said it would require my leaving the light on so that he could downgrade the light, thus allowing me to re-upgrade the app and light.

It took a while for us to coordinate on the fix (mostly my fault), since tech support is 6 hours earlier than my Eastern time zone in the US, but, once we finally got synced up, he performed the operation.

I re-upgraded and set the 20% brightness/2700K settings as the default (in the "device" option at the bottom of the app‚Äîjust customize your settings, tap the light switch icon at the top right of the app, and follow the prompts to "add" the custom defaults).  Now it works again the way it always used to, so I‚Äôm very satisfied.

Obviously, the system shouldn‚Äôt have done this to begin with, so 4 stars not 5, but tech support really came through and went the extra mile to make it work.  Before you rate this product too low, check with tech support.  You may just need to get your lights reprogrammed from the source!
